byline.contributor: Christina Capecchi reported from Bloomington, Minn., and Katie Rogers from New York.
byline.original: By CHRISTINA CAPECCHI and KATIE ROGERS

abstract: Killing of Cecil the lion in Zimbabwe has spurred outrage online and made Dr Walter J Palmer, who has said he was unaware hunt was illegal, target of Internet vigilantism; Palmer's dental practice in Bloomington, Minn, remains closed, and its Yelp page has been bombarded with angry reviews; many of those incensed by killing have taken to social media to vent their frustration.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Walter J. Palmer, the hunter who killed Cecil after he was lured out of his sanctuary at Hwange National Park in Zimbabwe, has faced an onslaught from social media users and online reviewers.

headline.main: Killer of Cecil the Lion Finds Out That He Is a Target Now, of Internet Vigilantism
headline.print_headline: Killer of Cecil the Lion Finds Out That He Is a Target Now, of Internet Vigilantism

snippet: Dr. Walter J. Palmer, the hunter who killed Cecil after he was lured out of his sanctuary at Hwange National Park in Zimbabwe, has faced an onslaught from social media users and online reviewers.
